intro: Stemonurus dolichocarpus, commonly known as the long-fruited stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, spicy scent when crushed. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
